subject: Music
title: Lennon and McCartney: The Perfect Partnership
description: A short lesson to help you apply Lennon and McCartney: The Perfect Partnership.

hook.text: Lennon and McCartney wrote 180 songs together â€” the most successful songwriting team in history.

buildup.text: They met as teenagers in Liverpool and agreed that every song would be credited to both.

discovery.text: Lennon brought edge and honesty. McCartney brought melody and optimism. Together: perfection.

twist.text: By 1969, they were barely speaking â€” writing separately but still under the shared credit.

climax.text: Their rivalry pushed each to write better than either could alone.

punchline.text: Competition made them better. Separation proved they needed each other.

quiz.question: How many songs did Lennon and McCartney write together?
